facts: Alaska is the largest U.S. state by land area and is bigger than the next three largest states (Texas, California, and Montana) combined.
Hawaii is the only U.S. state made entirely of islands and it is located in the middle of the Pacific Ocean.
The Mississippi River system is one of the longest river systems in the world and drains water from a huge part of the United States.
Denali in Alaska is the highest mountain in North America, rising 20,310 feet (6,190 meters) above sea level.
Death Valley in California contains the lowest point in North America, Badwater Basin, which is about 282 feet (86 meters) below sea level.
The Four Corners is the only place in the United States where four states meet at one point: Arizona, New Mexico, Colorado, and Utah.
Lake Superior is the largest of the Great Lakes by surface area and holds more water than the other four Great Lakes combined.
